page.title: 14A FARMER
page.content: The farmer lives at{Gubbins Hole Farm in the east of the parish towards Edgcott.The name is derived from {Gibbewin,}the family that owned one of the manors in Marsh Gibbon in the 12th century,although the house only dates from 1860. He owns{130 acres}of land divided into 11 fields,all used for grazing. His family owns 90 cows,5 sheep,2 dogs,1 rabbit,1 guinea pig,1 hamster 3 ducks and some chickens. He has a {caravan site}on his farm which can accomodate 5 Caravan Club caravans He has lived in Marsh Gibbon for 14 years and enjoys life on the farm but not when it is wet or very cold. He has to get up at 6 o'clock.He likes the variation of jobs throughout the the year. He is a member of the United Reformed Church.
